processingResourceMetaData.name: FolderReader
processingResourceMetaData.description:
This object reads through files and folders and selects all files that match the search criteria. It then loads the appropriate file reader object and populates the CAS.
Please note that all header parameters are case senseative. ID is not the same as id or Id. I might fix this in future revisions but for now, we expect that the CSV headers will match whichever information is in the array.
Also, this application will match headers in order. If the user specifies the CsvIdHeaders field as
CsvIdHeaders = ["id", "Id", "ID", "IDENTIFIER"]
and the spreadsheet contains an "IDENTIFIER" and an "id" column, the application marks the "id" column as the id column.

configurationParameter.name: IsRecursive
configurationParameter.description: Should the application perform a recursive walk over the base directory or only look in the base folder? Set to "true" to use a recursive walk.

configurationParameter.name: ReadPdf
configurationParameter.description: Should the search include pdf documents?

configurationParameter.name: ReadCsv
configurationParameter.description: Should the search include csv documents?

configurationParameter.name: ReadHtml
configurationParameter.description: Should the search include html documents?

configurationParameter.name: ReadWord
configurationParameter.description: Should the search include word documents?

configurationParameter.name: CsvIdHeaders
configurationParameter.description: This is the set of labels that will represent the id column in csv files. If the user does not provide a list of labels to use for lookup, it will default to "id".

configurationParameter.name: CsvTextHeaders
configurationParameter.description: The list of values that will define text columns in the csv file.

configurationParameter.name: DataType
configurationParameter.description:
This specifies how the applciation should insert the data.
DataType = 0: Source data/data to categorize DataType = 1: Category data/model data DataType = 2: Both for a full many to many mapping.
The default is 0.

configurationParameter.name: DatabaseServer
configurationParameter.description: The database server to connect to.

configurationParameter.name: Database
configurationParameter.description: Database to connect to on the server.

configurationParameter.name: DatabaseUserName
configurationParameter.description: The username for the connecting user

configurationParameter.name: DatabasePassword
configurationParameter.description: Password for the associated database user. Please note that this is clearcase in plain text. There might be additional options to connect to a database, but for now, localhost is the database to connect to.

configurationParameter.name: DatabasePort
configurationParameter.description: This is the port to atempt to connect to. If this is not provided, it will atempt to connect to the default port based on the type provided.

configurationParameter.name: DatabaseType
configurationParameter.description: This is the database type we are trying to connect to. This is required if the DatabasePort value is not assigned. The port will be assigned the default value for the database type.
